results.title: Kidnapped
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Robert Louis Stevenson, the film follows the adventures of David Balfour (James Macarthur) and his heroic attempts to regain his inherited property - the house and lands of the Shaws in Scotland. Cast includes John McIntyre, Peter Finch and Miles Malleson.

results.title: Kid nerd
results.creator_credit: Shereen Jerrett, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Former self confessed ‘nerds’, offer candid views on what it was like to be isolated and bullied in high school and how their lives have turned out. Although those interviewed share their moments of past pain, most of them have gone on to successful and creative ventures, which may have only been possible because of their distinct personalities. An entertaining documentary that nerds and non nerds alike will be able to relate to.

results.title: Kid brother
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, Irving Jacoby, Mental Health Board and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: A 1950s social guidance film, unique in its ability to explore adolescent behaviour without passing judgement. A teenager, unable to deal with his brother’s imminent marriage, becomes increasingly drunk at the engagement party. His actions are misunderstood by everyone but his brother. The film appeals to the audience to look beneath the surface for an explanation to the teenager’s behaviour, suggesting that he is frustrated and unable to express himself. Performances are by students and the faculty of the State Teachers’ Collegeat Montclair, New Jersey and by neighbours genuinely interested in the problems of young people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alexander Hammid, Irving Jacoby, Mental Health Board and Affiliated Film Producers

results.title: Kicking on
results.brief_description: Using the great Australian sporting tradition of Aussie rules as a catalyst to explore gay male sexuality, this sweet, funny take on mateship and fair play on and off the field gives a whole new meaning to the term ‘holding the man’. Kicking on ultimately highlights the intimate spaces men create for each other that allow for physical contact and a dogmatic loyalty that in any other name would be called love.

results.title: Kicking on
results.creator_credit: Jaime Browne and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: The boys at the local football club go into denial when they hear a rumour that one of their team was seen kissing a guy from another team outside the pub the night before. The best friend of the accused is forced to face some home truths when he confronts his mate. A loving parody of local footy culture that challenges entrenched homophobic attitudes that equate sporting prowess with heteromasculinity. Winner of best Australian short queer film and the Melbourne Queer Film Festival 2001. Cast includes Justin Foster, Neil Hutchins, Ben Redford and Jake Jacobson.

results.title: Kick to kick [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tony McNamara, Fiona Tuomy and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An hilarious short Australian film in which Derek and Kay teach their son Hec “how to use his body” and the finer points of Australian Rules football in a backyard game of Kick-to-Kick. A must-see for football supporters of all ages. Starring Richard Healy, Caz Lederman and Matt Long.

results.title: Kick me
results.brief_description: Amusing animated cartoon drawn directly onto the frames of 35mm motion picture film. An action filled story involving a pair of legs, a baseball and a gang of spiders.
